website_summaries.verdict: Asus' VivoBook S510 is both lightweight (3.7 pounds) and light on your wallet ($799). It doesn't blow away more costly desktop-replacement laptops, but it'll serve cash-strapped buyers well.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent laptop, very happy with my purchase. Only problems I have are that there is no fingerprint sensor as described and the trackpad is poor. Other than that it has fantastic battery life, very fast and a beautiful build and screen. Highly recommend for anyone who travels or goes to university.
customer_reviews.author: Emma Meehan

customer_reviews.title: WiFi card issues
customer_reviews.text: The laptop itself is perfect, but I cannot give it anything more than 1 star until they respond to my issue about the internal WiFi card being broken. I have only had the laptop for 2 months and only started using it more heavily recently due to university starting soon. I noticed the connection drops every 5 or so minutes, sometimes even faster. I bought a USB3 to Ethernet cable to actually have a stable connection for the time being, but this requires me to be connected via an ethernet cable. I'd rather they fixed this issue as I don't want to have to buy an external WiFi card and use up a USB port.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Also I am very satisfied with battery life
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for university works and a tad bit of gaming. Vectorworks takes some time to load but works perfectly. Also I am very satisfied with battery life. Lasts around 5 hours of gaming, 6-7 of music. Is really comfortable and light so perfect for commuting. Overall 10/10 worth the purcase.
customer_reviews.author: Marija Miliukaite

customer_reviews.title: An excellent laptop for the money
customer_reviews.text: An excellent laptop for the money. The keyboard is quite good for a fairly slim designed laptop. Its quite light and easy to transport around . It is more than adequate for average home use but would struggle with resource demanding high end games and video editing, as would any laptop in this price range. Overall this well designed, good value laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Mr M.

customer_reviews.title: Lot of money for poor quality product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this model last year.After 14 months the cooling fan started to make loud noise.I contacted Asus customer help line,because it is out of warranty that I had to pay for the repairs.Since I paid £669 for the laptop, I excepted the product to last longer than 14 months.
customer_reviews.author: jags

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter she loves. The audio is great. it is light and fast. Price ok too.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: really good laptop well worth the money - bought a present one very happy wife
customer_reviews.author: DarinMc

customer_reviews.title: Speedy and very stylish.
customer_reviews.text: It works for me - fast and a breath of fresh air compared with an old hard Drive.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie H

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great to work with. Keys a bit soft but get used to. No ethernet connection which I found strange.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Apart from the keyboard which is not nice, the rest is fine
customer_reviews.author: ALTWEGG-BOUSSAC TRISTAN

customer_reviews.title: Light to carry and powerful enough to run basic 3d games
customer_reviews.text: Light enough to be carried and powerful enough to run 3d games based on popular game engines such as Unreal and Cryengine. One strange quirk I found is that when the machine gets hot and throttles performance (perfcap) an HDMI connected monitor temporarily blackscreens - the internal display does not do this. Originally put off but the colour but the 'gold' finish is quite understated.
customer_reviews.author: JimF

customer_reviews.title: so so happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.text: beautiful, fast, with an amazing screen, i can't believe i have a laptop this great at that price
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: ... by hermes but carton box was damaged it looks like someone checked whats inside but the seal on laptop ...
customer_reviews.text: Quick delivery by hermes but carton box was damaged it looks like someone checked whats inside but the seal on laptop box was alright so overall seems good so 3stars for the doggy delivery!!! Amazon UK!!! Cheers
customer_reviews.author: vytautas visockas

customer_reviews.title: but extremely disappointed that it is not the same as the picture ...
customer_reviews.text: the laptop is ok, but extremely disappointed that it is not the same as the picture that advertises it, i.e no fingerprint scanner, which I thought I was getting and one of reason that pushed me in this direction to buy after looking at different machines, will give a honest review of laptop after using for a month but still a bit pissed about misleading advertising
customer_reviews.author: craig

customer_reviews.title: very very poor
customer_reviews.text: This is not a cheap laptop but its a very poor one no good for games can not even run Spider Solitaire properly no good to watch films as there is very little volume the track pad is the worst I have ever used On the plus side the start up time is very good and battery life is OK So to sum up if you want a laptop with fast starting good battery but is totally useless this might be the one for you
customer_reviews.author: pauldmaynard

customer_reviews.title: Great when it's working
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy with this laptop until 5 months had passed and all of a sudden I started having issues with the battery. It would randomly switch itself off for no reason and refused to charge at all. It then began charging sometimes and not others, sometimes holding the charge and sometimes not. I sent it to Asus who came back saying there was no issue but thankfully Amazon refunded me. Don't know if mine was just faulty or not which is a shame because it was a great laptop before these issues.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: AC and audio should be on left
customer_reviews.text: Great notebook but how dumb you have to be to place AC and Audio on the right side where the mouse is? Asus designers never use AC or mouse with their laptops?
customer_reviews.author: Mat3000

customer_reviews.title: The best laptop you can buy
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable laptop! Passes all expectations. Super quick, great sound quaility, easy to transport, amazing screen.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

product_meta.title: ASUS S510UQ-BQ178T VivoBook Slim 15.6 Inch Nano Edge Screen - (Gold) (Intel Core i5-7200U, 8 GB RAM, 256GB SSD, Nvidia GTX940MX, Windows 10)
product_meta.description:
S510UQ/i5 15.6" FHD 8GB 256GB Win 10 - ASUS Vivo Book S15 gives you the perfect combination of beauty and performance. With its slim Nano Edge bezel, brushed-metal finish, the latest Intel Core i5 processor with 8GB RAM, and NVIDIA GeForce 940MX graphics, Vivo Book S15 is designed for today’s fast-paced urban lifestyle.

BOX CONTAINS
Asus S510UQ-BQ178T
feature_bullets: Ultra-thin metal chassis at just 17.9 mm thick
80% screen to body ratio, with ultra slim bezel for better viewing experience
Audio - Built-in Stereo 2 W Speakers And Microphone and ASUS SonicMaster Technology. Backlit keyboard
Dedicated Nvidia GeForce GT940MX 2 GB graphics
Powered by Intel's 7th Generation i5 processor
